eldridge-videos.title: Average Case for the Movie Problem

metadata.wang-videos:
1. part A: Binary search: motivation and recursive algorithm
  2. part B: correctness of binary search algorithm
  3. part C: time complexity analysis of binary search, solving recurrences
  4. Part D: more examples of solving recurrences

1. part A: Sorting: SelectionSort, and loop invariants
  2. part B: A faster algorithm: MergeSort, and solving its recurrence
  3. part C: 3way MergeSort
  4. Part D: The Movie problem revisited, and made faster!

1. part A: Order statistics, and idea behind QuickSelect algorithm
  2. part B: Partition procedure
  3. part C: Time complexity of QuickSelect, Randomized QuickSelect (and expected time), QuickSort

1. part A: Binary search tree (BST): motivation and properties
  2. part B: Operations in BST: search, min/max, insert...
  3. part C: Balanced BST
  4. Part D: Select operation in BST, augmenting data structures

1. part A: Hashing, motivation and hash functions
  2. part B: Hash tables
  3. part C: Use Hash table for faster algorithms, and downside of Hash tables

1. part A: Graphs: undirected and directed, motivations
  2. part B: Basics about graphs: degrees, paths, connected components
  3. part C: Graph representations: Ajacency matrix, Ajacency list, dictionary of sets

1. part A: Graphs search strategy: Breadth-first search(BFS), the algorithm
  2. part B: Full_BFS algorithm, and complexity analysis
  3. part C: Shortest path in unweighted graphs: definition and properties

1. part A: Using BFS for computing shortest path distances, and recovering shortest paths
  2. part B: more about BFS trees and how they encode shortest paths
  3. part C: Introduction to the DFS (depth-first-search) algorithm

1. part A: Nesting properties of DFS
  2. part B: DAG and topological sort

1. part A: Weighted graphs, shortest paths and properties
  2. part B: Does BFS algorithm work for weighted graphs?
  3. part C: Key operation for shortest paths: update(edge)
  4. part D: Bellman-Ford algorithm
  5. part E: Early stopping and negative-cycle detection in Bellman-Ford algorithm

1. part A: Dijkstra algorithm for shortest path in positively weighted graphs
  2. part B: Correctness of Dijkstra algorithm
  3. part C: Efficient implementation of Dijkstra algorithm

metadata.topic: Minimum Spanning Trees and Prim's Algorithm
metadata.wang-videos:
1. part A: Trees and minimum spanning trees
  2. part B: Properties of MST, and Prim's algorithm
  3. part C: Implementation of Prim's algorithm

1. part A: Idea for Kruskal's algorithm
  2. part B: MST and clustering
  3. (Optional) part C: Hierarchical clustering and single-linkage (not required)
